intro: Sphaeradenia garciae subsp. cuadrosii, commonly known as the Cuadros's sphaeradenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows as an epiphytic or lithophytic plant, often found on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in the biodiversity of its native habitats.
